suncertify.application
Class BusinessInterface

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.application.BusinessInterface

public final class BusinessInterface
extends java.lang.Object

Provides a business method for each use case of the application: listing all valid records, searching for records by name and/or location and booking a record.

Internally the class uses an instance of some class implementing the DBAccess interface to access the data. Since the implementation only uses the methods provided by the DBAccess interface, we do not need to distinguish whether we operate directly on a data file or whether the data operations are sent over a network.

The business methods manage the flow of activities and provide the necessary synchronisation for calls to the DBAccess instance.

searchRecords

public java.util.List<DataRecord> searchRecords(java.lang.String name,
                                                java.lang.String location)
Returns a list of the data records that exactly match the specified criteria. A criteria value of null matches any field value.

Parameters:
name - Criteria for the name field
location - Criteria for the location field
Returns:
all data records exactly matching the criteria

bookRecord

public java.util.List<DataRecord> bookRecord(DataRecord record,
                                             java.util.List<DataRecord> records)
                                      throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                             RecordAlreadyBookedException
Tries to book the record with the specified record number. Throws a RecordAlreadyBookedException if the record was already booked.

Parameters:
record - data record that shall be booked.
records - records currently displayed in the view
Returns:
updated records
Throws:
RecordAlreadyBookedException - if the record was already booked.
RecordNotFoundException - if no record with the given record number exists or if it is marked as deleted
